revised_title: Description of a Hand Spectrum-Telescope and Its Applications
tldr: William Huggins describes a hand-held spectrum-telescope, suitable for observing the spectra of meteors, fireworks, and celestial objects like the Great Nebula in Orion. The instrument uses a direct-vision prism and a small achromatic telescope, allowing for the observation of bright lines from various elements. Huggins also discusses potential uses of the telescope during a solar eclipse and its possible applications in secret communication.
